title: PJ’s picks — the best video games this fall
text:
Be on the lookout for Star Wars, Luigi and Pokemon

This has been a great year for gaming, thanks to new titles like Kingdom Hearts 3, Super Mario Maker 2 and Apex Legends.

And 2019 isn’t even over yet.

There are still a bunch of cool games set to come out before 2020.

Here is a quick list of the top five to be on the lookout for.

Star Wars Jedi: Fall Order

This is a game people have been getting insanely hyped about for a while now.

Ever since Star Wars: Knights of The Old Republic (another Star Wars RPG — or role-playing game) came out way back in 2003, gamers have been begging for a bigger, better sequel.

And from the looks of the gameplay trailers, many people believe that EA (Electronic Arts) really delivered.

(YouTube)

The fact that it’s a Star Wars title could be contributing to the hype, but come on, who hasn’t wanted to be a Jedi, use the force and swing a laser sword at least once in their life?

The Legend of Zelda: Link’s Awakening

Let me just start this one by saying that the graphics look so lovable and charming.

How can you not play a game where all the characters all look so darn cute?

Besides the adorableness factor of Link, this game is actually getting people excited for a different reason: it’s a remake of a 1993 game released under the same title.

The refreshed remake of the game features a retro art style — do you like it? (Nintendo)

That game was well-loved, but had many limitations because it was released on the Game Boy.

Now on the Switch, we’re all hoping that they’ve patched up some of the old shortcomings so we can enjoy this game in all its cuteness, while also having a solid Zelda experience.

Luigi’s Mansion 3

When I first heard of Luigi's Mansion, I was definitely confused.

Mario's brother inherits a mansion, discovers that it's haunted and then decides to get rid of all the ghosts by sucking them into his super-powered vacuum.

Not exactly your average game formula, but this just might work.

When I’ve played these games in the past, it was when I was just looking for a bit of fun, and that's exactly what this series has always offered.

Prepare for a scare! The original Luigi’s Mansion came out for the GameCube in 2001. (Nintendo)

On top of that, you play as Luigi, which I think is a major bonus.

I love this lanky green plumber, and it’s great seeing his reactions to all the different ghost types that are found in the mansion (including ghost dogs!).

Overall, If you’re looking for polished, entertaining experience, this is the game you should look out for.

Skatebird

This game is definitely not at the top of most people's lists.

Before you start calling me crazy, just hear me out.

This game comes from an indie developer and involves the player doing sick skateboard tricks as a hawk named Tony.

No, I’m not joking.

On top of that, according to the game developers, Skatebird is “all about trying your best.”

That's adorable!

Ever seen a bird do a kickflip before? I thought not. Soar and skate to new heights in Skatebird. (Glass Bottom Games)

Sorry, Link's Awakening, Skatebird just took the No. 1 cutest game award of 2019.

Honestly though, this game looks like tons of fun, and sometimes it's good to try games from smaller developers.

They might really surprise you.

Pokemon Sword and Shield

To round off this list is one of the greatest franchises of all time — Pokemon.

This game doesn’t do anything super radical to change the formula, but that could be a good thing.

The last main series game — Let’s Go Pikachu! — was definitely a departure from some of the older games like Red and Blue or Diamond and Pearl (my personal favourites).

Two new legendary Pokémon, Zacian and Zamazenta will be available to catch in game. (Nintendo)

So many fans are excited for the return of the old battling and catching mechanics.

Plus, there are some new features: there’s a new region to explore, a new mechanic allowing trainers to “supersize” their Pokemon and more than 1,000 total Pokemon to catch.

That really must have been easier when there were only 151.

That’s my list! I hope there was at least one game on here that caught your attention.
